title: "Review: ‘Why We Drive’ skewers the utopianisms of driverless cars"
excerpt: "In “Why We Drive,” Matthew B. Crawford skewers the inevitability, and moral unassailability, of this solicitous vision. Crawford writes ecstatically of driving, evoking the sense of release and agency of flooring it out of the city as “a shady country road reels out ahead in rhythmic curves."
